name: Thiruvananthapuram
about: Thiruvananthapuram is the capital city of Kerala, known for its historical landmarks, temples, and coastal beauty.
culture: Thiruvananthapuram has a deep-rooted cultural history with strong traditions in classical music, dance, and art forms like Kathakali and Mohiniyattam.

places.name: Kovalam Beach
places.desc: Famous beach known for its crescent-shaped coastline and lighthouse views.

places.name: Padmanabhaswamy Temple
places.desc: Historic temple with Dravidian architecture.

places.name: Napier Museum
places.desc: Museum with a unique architectural style and a collection of historical artifacts.

places.name: Shankumugham Beach
places.desc: A tranquil beach popular for sunsets and sculptures.

places.name: Ponmudi
places.desc: A scenic hill station with winding pathways and lush greenery.

places.name: Agasthyakoodam
places.desc: A prominent peak in the Western Ghats, ideal for trekking and nature lovers.

name: Kollam
about: Kollam is famous for its serene backwaters, cashew industry, and historic trade links.
culture: Kollam celebrates vibrant festivals and is known for its boat races and traditional art forms.

places.name: Ashtamudi Lake
places.desc: Picturesque lake famous for houseboat cruises.

places.name: Thangassery Lighthouse
places.desc: Historic lighthouse offering panoramic sea views.

places.name: Palaruvi Waterfalls
places.desc: A beautiful waterfall surrounded by lush forests.

places.name: Jatayu Earth's Center
places.desc: A rock-themed park with the world's largest bird sculpture.

places.name: Thenmala
places.desc: India's first planned eco-tourism destination.

places.name: Munroe Island
places.desc: A cluster of islands famous for canal cruises and village life.

name: Pathanamthitta
about: Pathanamthitta is renowned for the Sabarimala temple and lush forested landscapes.
culture: The district is rich in temple festivals, folk arts, and religious harmony.

places.name: Sabarimala Temple
places.desc: Renowned pilgrimage center in the Western Ghats.

places.name: Aranmula Parthasarathy Temple
places.desc: Ancient temple famous for the Aranmula Boat Race.

places.name: Konni Elephant Training Center
places.desc: Famous for elephant training and forest adventures.

places.name: Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls
places.desc: A scenic waterfall ideal for picnics and photography.

places.name: Gavi
places.desc: Eco-tourism spot known for wildlife and trekking.

places.name: Pandalam Palace
places.desc: Historic palace associated with Lord Ayyappa.

name: Alappuzha
about: Alappuzha is known for its picturesque backwaters, houseboats, and coir industry.
culture: Famous for the Nehru Trophy Boat Race and vibrant Onam celebrations.

places.name: Alappuzha Backwaters
places.desc: Famous for houseboat cruises and scenic beauty.

places.name: Marari Beach
places.desc: Tranquil beach ideal for relaxation.

places.name: Pathiramanal Island
places.desc: A small island on Vembanad Lake, great for birdwatching.

places.name: Krishnapuram Palace
places.desc: Historic palace with mural paintings and museum.

places.name: Ambalapuzha Sree Krishna Temple
places.desc: Famous for its delicious 'palpayasam' and architecture.

places.name: Kuttanad
places.desc: Known as the 'Rice Bowl of Kerala', with scenic paddy fields.

name: Kottayam
tagline: Land of Letters, Lakes, and Latex
about: Kottayam is a hub of education, rubber plantations, and scenic lakes.
culture: Known for its literary heritage, churches, and traditional festivals.

places.name: Vembanad Lake
places.desc: Largest lake in Kerala, known for bird watching.

places.name: Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary
places.desc: Sanctuary with a variety of migratory birds.

places.name: Illikkal Kallu
places.desc: A majestic rock formation with panoramic views.

places.name: St. Mary's Church, Manarcad
places.desc: Ancient church famous for its annual feast.

places.name: Vaikom Mahadeva Temple
places.desc: One of the oldest and most revered Shiva temples.

places.name: Poonjar Palace
places.desc: A historic palace with royal antiques and artifacts.

name: Idukki
about: Idukki is a mountainous district famous for its wildlife sanctuaries, tea gardens, and dams.
culture: Home to tribal communities and unique hill traditions.

places.name: Munnar
places.desc: Hill station famous for tea plantations.

places.name: Idukki Arch Dam
places.desc: Asia's first and largest arch dam.

places.name: Thekkady
places.desc: Famous for Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary and boating.

places.name: Ramakkalmedu
places.desc: A windy hilltop with panoramic views.

places.name: Anamudi Peak
places.desc: The highest peak in South India.

places.name: Eravikulam National Park
places.desc: Home to the endangered Nilgiri Tahr.

name: Ernakulam
about: Ernakulam is the commercial capital of Kerala, blending modernity with heritage.
culture: A melting pot of cultures, with historic temples, churches, and synagogues.

places.name: Fort Kochi
places.desc: Historic area with colonial architecture.

places.name: Cherai Beach
places.desc: Popular beach with golden sands.

places.name: Jew Town & Synagogue
places.desc: Historic area with antique shops and a 16th-century synagogue.

places.name: Marine Drive
places.desc: A scenic promenade along the backwaters.

places.name: Hill Palace Museum
places.desc: Kerala's largest archaeological museum.

places.name: Bolgatty Palace
places.desc: A heritage hotel on Bolgatty Island.

name: Thrissur
about: Thrissur is famous for its Pooram festival, temples, and vibrant cultural scene.
culture: Known for classical arts, literature, and grand festivals.

places.name: Vadakkunnathan Temple
places.desc: Ancient Shiva temple and UNESCO site.

places.name: Athirappilly Waterfalls
places.desc: Largest waterfall in Kerala, known as the Niagara of India.

places.name: Punnathur Kotta
places.desc: Elephant sanctuary housing temple elephants.

places.name: Kerala Kalamandalam
places.desc: Renowned center for learning classical arts.

name: Palakkad
about: Palakkad is known for its paddy fields, Palakkad Gap, and historic forts.
culture: Rich in folk music, dance, and traditional festivals.

places.name: Palakkad Fort
places.desc: Well-preserved fort built by Hyder Ali.

places.name: Silent Valley National Park
places.desc: Biodiversity hotspot with rare flora and fauna.

places.name: Malampuzha Dam & Gardens

places.desc: Wildlife sanctuary with tigers and elephants.

places.name: Nelliyampathy Hills
places.desc: Hill station with tea and coffee plantations.

places.name: Dhoni Waterfalls
places.desc: A scenic waterfall near Palakkad town.

name: Malappuram
about: Malappuram is noted for its rolling hills, rivers, and cultural diversity.
culture: Famous for Mappila arts, literature, and religious harmony.

places.name: Kottakkunnu
places.desc: Hill garden with panoramic views.

places.name: Nilambur Teak Museum

places.name: Thirunavaya Temple

places.name: Angadipuram Temple

places.name: Adyanpara Waterfalls
places.desc: A beautiful waterfall in the Nilambur region.

name: Kozhikode
about: Kozhikode is a historic port city known for its spice trade and beaches.
culture: Renowned for its cuisine, music, and festivals.

places.name: Kappad Beach
places.desc: Historic beach where Vasco da Gama landed.

places.desc: Urban park with a historic pond.

places.name: Tali Temple

name: Wayanad
about: Wayanad is a hill district with forests, wildlife, and tribal heritage.
culture: Home to indigenous tribes and unique folk traditions.

places.desc: Caves with ancient petroglyphs.

places.name: Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary

places.name: Soochipara Falls

name: Kannur
about: Kannur is famous for its handloom industry, beaches, and Theyyam rituals.

places.desc: A small island accessible during low tide.

about: Kasaragod is known for its forts, beaches, and linguistic diversity.
culture: Rich in temple festivals, Yakshagana, and multicultural traditions.

places.desc: Largest fort in Kerala with sea views.
